messages.msgSnippet: Conversations gleaned from several Digests... ... on 1/4/03 10:55 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at ... There s a great group in Oak Park. Not totally
messages.messageBody:
Conversations gleaned from several Digests...

> on 1/1/03 6:28 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>
>> Hi,
>>
>> Anyone on the list from the south suburbs of Chicago?
>>
>> Suzanne
>
> Nope, but I'm from the actual city of Chicago!
> Paula
>
> Subject: Re: Digest Number 2786

on 1/4/03 10:55 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> Paula,
>
> Can you recommend a Homeschool group that is rather informal? I'm hoping to
> find one that emphasizes social time.

There's a great group in Oak Park. Not totally unschooling, but very
inclusive. You can email the umbrella HOUSE group at
illinois_house@..., and they will hook you up.

Paula
*******************************************************
HOUSE is definitely the group you want. Families actually travel many miles
to attend HOUSE gatherings.

When our family traveled from Montana to Chicago for NHA council meetings
years ago, we always were welcomed into anything HOUSE had going.

John Holt Days were potluck get-togethers for a day at someones house,
another a day for pizza and play at Little Ceasar's up Harlem at Foster, I
believe. Many other days too. Great bunch of folks!

Don't hesitate, email right away. If you get toether with the Oak Park
group say hello from the Barda Allen/George Prudden family.

Peace and Love...
Barda Allen
315 State Street
Helena, MT 59601
406-449-7513
HeavensOnEarth@...
--
"Shipping" is My Business -
What is the "Shipping" Business?

RelationShip,
FriendShip,
PartnerShip,
LeaderShip

Who is this Barda Allen?
http://www.greatestnetworker.com/is/barda_a_allen


http://www.spiritualpartnering.com/projectprosperity?Barda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2786
messages.msgSnippet: ... the ... Helen ... The individual posts get it at the bottom.  A little easier to ignore, which can be both good and bad.   Tia
messages.messageBody:
> Every digest I get says this at the top:
>
> > If you have questions, concerns or problems with this list, please email
the
> > moderator, Joyce Fetteroll (fetteroll@...), or the list owner,
Helen
> > Hegener (HEM-Editor@...).

The individual posts get it at the bottom. A little easier to ignore, which
can be both good and bad. <g>
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2786
messages.msgSnippet: ... I ve never gotten this list off-digest, so I have no idea if this shows up at all the way most folks seem to receive their mail (one piece at a time). It s
messages.messageBody:
1/4/03 17:55:


> Well, thats nice to know :-) .. How else would I know that if I didnt ask?
>

Every digest I get says this at the top:

> If you have questions, concerns or problems with this list, please email the
> moderator, Joyce Fetteroll (fetteroll@...), or the list owner, Helen
> Hegener (HEM-Editor@...).

I've never gotten this list off-digest, so I have no idea if this shows up
at all the way most folks seem to receive their mail (one piece at a time).
It's nice to have that info there, since it does tell you who's "in charge".
That way, if people have comments, they can send them direct. (hint, hint)

brenda
